Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk compat-dapl
exit 0

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dapl-static

Vulnerability.Title: RDMA stack bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux includes a collection of Infiniband and iWARP utilities, libraries and development packages for writing applications that use Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) technology. The RDMA stack packages have been upgraded to newer upstream versions, which provide a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions: The openmpi packages have been updated to version 1.10.0. (BZ#947311) The mstflint packages have been updated to version 4.0.1. (BZ#1164542) The ibacm packages have been updated to version 1.1.0. (BZ#1169952) The libibumad packages have been updated to version 1.3.10.2. (BZ#1169962) The libmlx5 packages have been updated to version 1.0.2. (BZ#1164544) The infiniband-diags packages have been updated to version 1.6.5. (BZ#1169968) The perftest packages have been updated to version 2.4. (BZ#1182177) The ibacm packages have been updated to version 1.1.0. (BZ#1249809) The dapl packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on Power little endian or ARM 64-bit hardware architectures. (BZ#1197216) This update also fixes the following bug: Previously, the setup-mlx4.sh script was executed incorrectly because of a file name mismatch in the libmlx4.conf modprobe file. Consequently, the port type settings in the /etc/rdma/mlx4.conf file were not applied. With this update, libmlx4.conf has been fixed to reference the correct file name when attempting to run the setup-mlx4.sh script. As a result, the settings from /etc/rdma/mlx4.conf are properly applied. (BZ#1227995) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: Previously, under high traffic loads, when performing checksum calculations on IP traffic, CPU usage could be significant. This update enables checksum offload for the IP over Infiniband (IPoIB) Unreliable Datagram (UD) mode and Raw Ethernet Queue pair types. As a result, CPU usage is reduced. (BZ#1195888) Users of RDMA stack are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note that the RDMA stack is designed to work as a coordinated unit. Users are supposed to update either all or none of the packages. Also, these packages must be used with the kernel packaged with the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2. It is not advised to use for example the kernel from the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.1 with the RDMA packages that are included in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
